original_title: Sri Lanka to try prepaid cards for bus transit again, this time with QR codes
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) plans to introduce a cashless, QR code-based automated bus ticket issuing system in 2023, Transport Minister Bandula Gunawardean said.
Speaking at an event in Nuwara Eliya on Sunday April 09, Gunawardena said the new system, which will see QR-enabled cards issued to passengers, will be launched in due course.
Sri Lanka has been discussing cashless public transit systems for years. In 2012, a prepaid “smart card” facility was announced for both SLTB and private sector-run buses.
This is did not pan out, and in April 2021, fresh plans were drawn up for a prepaid smart card for public transport.

Public transport, chiefly buses and trains, are the most widely used mode of transit in Sri Lanka. Buses are run by the state-run SLTB and private bus operators. Critics complain that both SLTB and private buses could do with improved services and facilities.
A recently announced expansion of the SLTB with 500 buses bought on credit from India would end up reducing passengers for private busses, the head of the private bus industry association said.
